poem:
"Sketches from a War's Sharp Edge"

Trapped in the theatre of war,
the afterthoughts of peace crumble.
A husband and wife, caught in the crosshairs,
dance on the precipice of treachery,
while an innocent soldier plays puppet to the puppeteers.
From apartment windows, the bleak ballet of geopolitics
unfolds, a rocket's echo the only applause,
and all of us stand accused,
lost in the labyrinth of complicity.
